citations.narrative:
In the Red Tailed Hawk enclosure, a loose/broken board and debris were accumulated on the top of the enclosure,
bowing down the roof. All enclosures must be kept in good repair, protect the birds from injury and restrict other animals
from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds.

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live birds.
citations.narrative:
The transport enclosures had some ventilation holes, including on the top but did not meet the ventilation and projecting
rim requirements under 3.162 (b), which requires 8% of all vertical walls or 16% of opposing walls and 0.75 inches of a
projecting rim. Transport enclosures must meet the ventilation requirements.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Ashley Alger n

narrative:
3.150(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
In the Red Tailed Hawk enclosure, a loose/broken board and debris were accumulated on the top of the enclosure, 
bowing down the roof. All enclosures must be kept in good repair, protect the birds from injury and restrict other animals 
from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds. 
3.162(a)(9) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live birds. 
The transport enclosures had some ventilation holes, including on the top but did not meet the ventilation and projecting 
rim requirements under 3.162 (b), which requires 8% of all vertical walls or 16% of opposing walls and 0.75 inches of a 
projecting rim. Transport enclosures must meet the ventilation requirements. 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection. 
 
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License. 
 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Ashley Alger n
